    • Method Detail

      • queryString

        public static String queryString(Map<String,Object> values)
        Convert a Map to a query string.
        Parameters:
        values - the map with the values null will be encoded as empty string, all other objects are converted to String by calling its toString() method.
        Returns:
        e.g. "key1=value&key2=&email=max%40example.com"

      • toJsonObject

        public static org.json.JSONObject toJsonObject(byte[] bytes)
        Convert a byte array to a JSONObject.
        Parameters:
        bytes - a UTF-8 encoded string representing a JSON object.
        Returns:
        the parsed object
        Throws:
        WebbException - in case of error (usually a parsing error due to invalid JSON)

      • toJsonArray

        public static org.json.JSONArray toJsonArray(byte[] bytes)
        Convert a byte array to a JSONArray.
        Parameters:
        bytes - a UTF-8 encoded string representing a JSON array.
        Returns:
        the parsed JSON array
        Throws:
        WebbException - in case of error (usually a parsing error due to invalid JSON)

      • readBytes

        public static byte[] readBytes(InputStream is)
                        throws IOException
        Read an InputStream into byte[] until EOF.
        Does not close the InputStream!
        Parameters:
        is - the stream to read the bytes from
        Returns:
        all read bytes as an array
        Throws:
        IOException

      • copyStream

        public static void copyStream(InputStream input,
              OutputStream output)
                       throws IOException
        Copy complete content of InputStream to OutputStream until EOF.
        Does not close the InputStream nor OutputStream!
        Parameters:
        input - the stream to read the bytes from
        output - the stream to write the bytes to
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getRfc1123DateFormat

        public static DateFormat getRfc1123DateFormat()
        Creates a new instance of a DateFormat for RFC1123 compliant dates.
        Should be stored for later use but be aware that this DateFormat is not Thread-safe!
        If you have to deal with dates in this format with JavaScript, it's easy, because the JavaScript Date object has a constructor for strings formatted this way.
        Returns:
        a new instance
